intro: Waldheimia transalaica, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and alpine settings.
